intro: Tubella carinilabia, commonly known as the horned liverwort, is a type of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, leafy plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant features a thallus with distinct lobes and a central ridge, giving it its common name. Its reproductive structures, including male and female gametophytes, are often found on the underside of the leaves. Tubella carinilabia plays a vital role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its ecosystem.
